016    package com.googlecode.streamflyer.thirdparty;
017    
018    /**
019     * The code of this class is copied from class <code>org.springframework.util.Assert</code>
020     * in order to avoid additional dependencies to other projects.
021     * <p>
022     * The name is prefixed with <code>Zzz</code> to avoid confusion in case the
023     * original classes are also available in classpath.  
024     */
025    
026    /**
027     * Assertion utility class that assists in validating arguments. Useful for
028     * identifying programmer errors early and clearly at runtime.
029     * <p>
030     * For example, if the contract of a public method states it does not allow
031     * <code>null</code> arguments, ZzzAssert can be used to validate that contract.
032     * Doing this clearly indicates a contract violation when it occurs and protects
033     * the class's invariants.
034     * <p>
035     * Typically used to validate method arguments rather than configuration
036     * properties, to check for cases that are usually programmer errors rather than
037     * configuration errors. In contrast to config initialization code, there is
038     * usally no point in falling back to defaults in such methods.
039     * <p>
040     * This class is similar to JUnit's assertion library. If an argument value is
041     * deemed invalid, an {@link IllegalArgumentException} is thrown (typically).
042     * For example:
043     * 
044     * <pre class="code">
045     * ZzzAssert.notNull(clazz, &quot;The class must not be null&quot;);
046     * ZzzAssert.isTrue(i &gt; 0, &quot;The value must be greater than zero&quot;);
047     * </pre>
048     * 
049     * Mainly for internal use within the framework; consider Jakarta's Commons Lang
050     * >= 2.0 for a more comprehensive suite of assertion utilities.
051     * 
052     * @author Keith Donald
053     * @author Juergen Hoeller
054     * @author Colin Sampaleanu
055     * @author Rob Harrop
056     * @since 1.1.2
057     */
058    public abstract class ZzzAssert {
059    
060    
061        /**
062         * ZzzAssert that an object is not <code>null</code> .
063         * 
064         * <pre class="code">
065         * ZzzAssert.notNull(clazz, &quot;The class must not be null&quot;);
066         * </pre>
067         * 
068         * @param object the object to check
069         * @param message the exception message to use if the assertion fails
070         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the object is <code>null</code>
071         */
072        public static void notNull(Object object, String message) {
073            if (object == null) {
074                throw new IllegalArgumentException(message);
075            }
076        }
077    
078        /**
079         * ZzzAssert that an object is not <code>null</code> .
080         * 
081         * <pre class="code">
082         * ZzzAssert.notNull(clazz);
083         * </pre>
084         * 
085         * @param object the object to check
086         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the object is <code>null</code>
087         */
088        public static void notNull(Object object) {
089            notNull(object,
090                    "[Assertion failed] - this argument is required; it must not be null");
091        }
092    
093        /**
094         * ZzzAssert a boolean expression, throwing
095         * <code>IllegalArgumentException</code> if the test result is
096         * <code>false</code>.
097         * 
098         * <pre class="code">
099         * ZzzAssert.isTrue(i &gt; 0, &quot;The value must be greater than zero&quot;);
100         * </pre>
101         * 
102         * @param expression a boolean expression
103         * @param message the exception message to use if the assertion fails
104         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if expression is <code>false</code>
105         */
106        public static void isTrue(boolean expression, String message) {
107            if (!expression) {
108                throw new IllegalArgumentException(message);
109            }
110        }
111    
112        /**
113         * ZzzAssert a boolean expression, throwing
114         * <code>IllegalArgumentException</code> if the test result is
115         * <code>false</code>.
116         * 
117         * <pre class="code">
118         * ZzzAssert.isTrue(i &gt; 0);
119         * </pre>
120         * 
121         * @param expression a boolean expression
122         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if expression is <code>false</code>
123         */
124        public static void isTrue(boolean expression) {
125            isTrue(expression, "[Assertion failed] - this expression must be true");
126        }
127    }
